info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 07 at 3:01AM MST until June 07 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING BELOW 4000 FEET... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning below 4000 feet, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 110 expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures between 110 and 115 possible. * WHERE...Grand Canyon, especially near Phantom Ranch. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM MST this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Wednesday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: This warning is reserved for only the hottest days of the year and is issued when temperatures are expected to rise to dangerous levels. Day hikers on Bright Angel Trail should descend no further than 1 1/2 miles. Between 10 am and 4 pm...physical activity is discouraged. Hikers should attempt to be out of the canyon...at Indian Garden or Bright Angel campground between these hours. All hikers should have adequate gear...including a wide-brimmed hat...sunscreen...salty snacks...sufficient water and electrolyte mix. Doubling your calorie intake helps maintain your energy. Hike smart!
